item.title: Report X-2023090521
item.description:
Report X-2023090521

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-04T18:16:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-05
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The previously processed package was located in the haz cage inside a plastic bag and tote. Further inspection of package confirmed that one of the bottles inside was punctured and caused release of flammable liquid package. DescribePack: Small pin size punctured hole on the top of the bottle DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Evaporated

item.title: Report X-2023090112
item.description:
Report X-2023090112

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-04T18:16:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-05
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A wooden skid was discovered with signs of a release during sort operations at the ORDR facility. The skid had four steel drums banded together wrapped in plastic wrap. One of the drums was punctured on the bottom causing the release. The damaged drum was placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

item.title: Report E-2023100030
item.description:
Report E-2023100030

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 19, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1161 was crushed during transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1161-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and the damaged pail were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023090755
item.description:
Report E-2023090755

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: CASEYVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When driver went to go hook to trailer in drop lot he noticed liquid coming from trailer on the gravel lot. Driver then notified facility manager and a team was dispatcher out to facilitate the clean up. The trailer was moved to the dock to pull the container off and put on a containment pallet and absorbent was put down to prevent any spread of the material until the team could start the clean up. The response team arrived and had to remove the material from the container and put into a new one. Gravel from the lot had to be removed creating three 55 gallon drums of material. The inner liner of the bag was determined to be damaged from when it was filled causing the release. From the time it was identified to when clean up was complete was approximately 4 hours.

item.title: Report E-2023090754
item.description:
Report E-2023090754

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: SPRINGFIELD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 19, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1157 was forked and released approximately thirty (30) gallons of product to the trailer floor and concrete parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES Plus, LLC (ESP) to remediate the impacted surfaces. . ESP transferred the damaged drum from the trailer to an 85-gallon salvage drum. The crew deployed granular absorbents to the trailer floor and concrete parking lot. ESP utilized hand tools to collect the spent absorbents into three (3) 55-gallon drums for transport and disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023090752
item.description:
Report E-2023090752

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 19, 2023, one (1) 1-gallon jug of UN3264 was forked and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to the UN3264-impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents, the damaged jug, and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023090725
item.description:
Report X-2023090725

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: BELLEVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO UNLOAD 4 FOR A LEAKER. WHEN THE RESPONDER ARRIVED IN FULL PPE, HE NOTICED ONE OF THE LEAKED ON PACKAGES WAS A HAZMAT WITH SHIPPING PAPERS. RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE TO DMP IMMEDIATELY AND ISOLATED THE PACKAGE. AFTER THE RESPONDER TRANSPORTED ALL PACKAGES TO THE DMP AND IDENTIFIED THE LEAKING PACKAGE, THE RESPONDER ATTENDED TO THE HAZMAT AND DISCOVERED IT HAD A BOTTLE THAT WAS LEAKING IN ADDITION TO BEING LEAKED ON. THE RESPONDER LOCATED THE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET AND PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.

item.description:
Report E-2023090833

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 18Liter jug of anti friction coating (un1224) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 quart of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023090419
item.description:
Report X-2023090419

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: DECATUR
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package brought to QA with a wet, torn box. Bottle of Chlorine Sanitizer with a loose cap had leaked liquid into package which ate away at the cardboard. Exterior box did not have any hazmat placarding or identification at all. Box was isolated in QA. After inspecting contents saw possible hazmat item and checked SDS. DescribePack: Bottle of chlorine solution has cap that came loose, seal underneath cap became punctured or torn allowing chlorine solution to leak out into box and to eat away at it. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was isolated in lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023090315
item.description:
Report X-2023090315

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet and leaking a brown liquid after being unloaded from facility 537 after going over their overhead sorter. Package was found around 11:09am. Package smelled severely of alcohol. Package was not labeled a Hazmat but upon research via the Safety Data Sheet, it was determined that the product was a Category 3 Flammable Liquid. Package was immediately taken to the HazMat Cage in order to isolate it from the rest of the staff. DescribePack: 1 of the 4 plastic bottles inside the box had a very large tear at the shoulder of the item. This led to a leakage of Hazardous materials. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the HazMat Cage for isolation and processing.

item.title: Report X-2023090287
